I just bought another 3 pair of these.  I wear them every day driving and working a chemical tanker truck OTR.  This includes major chemical refineries and the oil fields in Midland, Odessa and Williston.  They last me about 3-4 years at this rate.  They're still holding up, just wash-faded now and worn around the pockets.  The heavyweight denim feels heavier than any other brand's I've seen and I said goodbye to a lifetime of Levi's once I found these.  I like the orange labels too when PPE is mandated by the plant I'm working in.
I like the fact that the pants stretch as you band it makes for easy working. Well all pants Bend and we know this but this is kind of like elastic a little bit

评论概述: Do not buy if you require FR rated clothes. These are not.
评论详情: The product description states that the jeans are FR rated. There are no identifying tags on the jeans and even the sewn on tags inside the jeans do not identify these as FR rated.  Waste of my buying these for work as FR clothes are required for work and there is nothing that supports the claim that these jeans are FR rated.

评论概述: Better in my opinion than Carhartt FR
评论详情: I used to buy nothing but Carhartt FR Jeans.  A few annoyances that I have had with the Carhartts is that the belt loops are in awkward places.  When placing a Leatherman or Gerber multi function tool on a belt, it would either be either too far forward or too far back. The fly on the Carhartt is cut weird where it almost seems like you have to stand on your tippy toes to go to the bathroom.  The zipper just doesn't seem to open far enough.  These Wranglers have corrected both issues besides being much more comfortable in general.  They are also less than 2/3 the price of what I used to pay.  I plan on buying these from now on.
